intro: Nototriche lanata, commonly known as the woolly nototriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woolly foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Nototriche lanata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
